page.title: 13HUTTON ESTATE - SHOOTING
page.content:
Most of the game shooting at Hutton is in the hands of Lord Inglewood's family, who employ a part-time game- keeper, Mr. G. Butterworth, whose task is to control vermin.
No pheasants are hand reared, but about three dozen ex-laying pen birds are released annually. In addition, pheasants and ducks are fed.
There are about six formal days' shooting, together with a number of informal days to which guests are invited.
An average annual bag is about 100 pheasants, and 160 'other', including wild duck, wood cock, snipe and hares.
